citation.article-title: Aestuariicola saemankumensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a member of the family Flavobacteriaceae, isolated from tidal flat sediment.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Aestuariicola [Aes.tu.a.ri.i.co′la. L. n. aestuarium part of the coast that overflows with seawater during a flood-tide and is left covered with mud or slime at ebb-tide, a tidal flat; L. suff. -cola (from L. n. incola) a dweller, inhabitant; N.L. masc. n. Aestuariicola a dweller in a tidal flat].
Cells are Gram-negative, non-flagellated, non-gliding and pleomorphic.
The major fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0, iso-C15 : 1 and iso-C17 : 0 3-OH.
The type species is Aestuariicola saemankumensis.
